title: Finance Tracker: Type-Safe Transactions
description:
Build a type-safe transaction system for the Personal Finance Tracker:

1. Create a TransactionDict TypedDict with: id (int), amount (float), category (str), is_expense (bool)
2. Add type hints to get_expenses() that filters only expense transactions
3. Add type hints to total_by_category() that groups spending by category

Use modern Python 3.10+ syntax (list[X], X | None, etc.)
instructions:
Build a type-safe transaction system for the Personal Finance Tracker:

1. Create a TransactionDict TypedDict with: id (int), amount (float), category (str), is_expense (bool)
2. Add type hints to get_expenses() that filters only expense transactions
3. Add type hints to total_by_category() that groups spending by category

Use modern Python 3.10+ syntax (list[X], X | None, etc.)

hints.text: For TypedDict: class TransactionDict(TypedDict): with fields. For functions: list[TransactionDict] for input, dict[str, float] for category totals.

commonMistakes.mistake: Using Optional instead of X | None
